awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences:  Analysis of Ice Core Time Series andPaleoclimate Modeling
awd_abstract_narration: This award supports the cross-disciplinary efforts and the                 development of a research collaboration involving quantitative                  modelling in the geosciences.  In particular the mathematician(s)               and the GEO scientist research will focus their attention on the                statistical and scientific analysis of records arising from ice                 cores taken from the Greenland ice sheet.  The two-phase                        interdisciplinary research will begin with the development of                   scientifically and statistically valid exploratory and                          confirmatory statistical techniques for assessing the record of                 the paleoclimate as recorded in the Greenland ice sheet.  The                   second phase will address the development of mathematical models                relating the environmental signals deposited in polar ice sheets                to important paleoclimate factors.  This project presents                       significant mathematical and statistical challenges to provide                  geoscientists with tools to be applied to the task of                           understanding the approximately 200,000 years od Earth's climatic               history.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
